name: Strathclyde Roundabout (day ranger - Greater Glasgow area)
description:
STRATHCLYDE ROUNDABOUT Unlimited off-peak travel for one day by rail and the Glasgow Subway in the Greater Glasgow area bounded by the following stations: Dalreoch, Milngavie, Croy, Cumbernauld, 
      Caldercruix, Carfin, Motherwell, East Kilbride, Neilston, Barrhead, Paisley Canal, Milliken Park and Bishopton

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 1st April 2025 One day ranger adult: £7.70 child (under 16): £3.85 railcards: no Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £7.40 2023 - £7.40 2022 - £7.40 2021 - £7.40 2020 - £7.40 2019 - £7.20 2018 - £7.00 2014 - £6.30 time restrictions Mon to Fri: from 09:00 No restrictions at weekends or Glasgow public holidays train operating companies Scotrail, Glasgow Subway purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: ✔ i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
